thread.title: President Trump weighs in on women’s marches, boasts about TV ratings on Twitter
thread.title_full: President Trump weighs in on women’s marches, boasts about TV ratings on Twitter

author: Rob Tornoe
title: President Trump weighs in on women’s marches, boasts about TV ratings on Twitter
text:
s women’s marches and boast about the television ratings of his inauguration. 
“” Trump shared on Twitter. 
— January 22, 2017 
s inauguration on Friday, according to the Associated Press . It was less than the 37.8 million people who tuned in to see President Obama first inauguration in 2009, but soundly beat the 20.6 million who viewed his second inauguration in 2013. 
Trumps total was also greater than both of President Clinton’s inaugurations, which garnered 29.7 and 21.6 million viewers. 
President Trump also weighed in on the womens marches that took place across the country on Saturday, including in Philadelphia , where an estimated 50,000 protesters marched to promote women’s rights. 
“” Trump posted on Twitter 
January 22, 2017 
As many as half a million people ’s march in Washington, D.C. on Saturday, which was packed with celebrity speakers, including Madonna, Amy Schumer, America Ferrera and Ashley Judd. 
Officials at Washingtons Metro transportation system says ridership was higher Saturday during the women's march than on Friday for President Trump’s inauguration. 
even busier than most weekdays. #wmata #womensmarch 
—
